text: we're looking at healthcare today

opting for the tax penalty and dates to
watch good evening this is the New York

roughly as many Americans with health
insurance disapprove of the Affordable
Care Act as those who are uninsured
about half said the affordability was
their main reason for not having
insurance in the first place you buy
insurance and your premiums were so high
that you couldn't even afford to go see
the doctor with health care now the law
anyone that misses a march 31st deadline
will pay a sizable tax penalty the poll
found that a little more than half of
uninsured Americans plan on signing up
for insurance by then but i will pay the
fine the be the tax whatever you want to
call it thirty-five percent of uninsured
Americans that they would rather pay the

starting January first and the big
